abstracts.cdata!:
This proposed amendment to the Loan
            Agreement for the Irrigated Land and Watershed Management
            Project, seeks approval to utilize un-disbursed amounts from
            the loan, to refinance the Project Preparation Facility
            (PPF) for the proposed Water and Sanitation Project in
            Tourism Areas. This will imply waiving on an exceptional
            basis in regard to the Refinancing of a PPF, thus allowing
            that the refinancing costs of the above PPF be funded
            through this loan. As per the Constitution of the Dominican
            Republic, this amendment will have to be ratified by
            Congress. Nevertheless, the amendment will serve the
            country's needs, and support their recovery efforts in
            this critical macroeconomic juncture; as such, it should be
            approved by the Board. Despite years of sustained growth,
            the country entered a period of recession, which although
            not fully evaluated, the social impacts of the crisis are
            dramatic, and the economy continues in crisis. The tight
            fiscal discipline required to meet the International
            Monetary Fund (IMF) targets, in addition to postponing the
            proposed project, is precluding the Government to proceed
            with an immediate repayment of the PPF advance, and accrued
            interests to the Bank. Given the above reasons, and the
            proper utilization of advance funds, the Board shall amend
            the Loan Agreement to include a new component that would
            cover the re-payment of the PPF through this Loan.
